title: A Randomized , Double Blind, Placebo Controlled, 3-Arm Parallel Design Study to Evaluate the Effects of BPN14770 in Patients With Early Stage Alzheimer's Disease

measures.title: Pre Treatment MMSE
measures.description: The MMSE consisted of 11 items covering orientation, memory (recent and immediate), concentration, language and praxis. Total score ranges from 0 (severe cognitive impairment) to 30 (intact cognitive function), with lower scores indicating greater cognitive impairment. In participants with a diagnosis of Alzheimer's Disease (AD), lower scores indicating worse disease. A score of 20 to 24 suggests mild dementia, 13 to 20 suggests moderate dementia, and less than 12 indicates severe dementia.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Repeatable Battery for the Assessment of Neurological Status- Delayed Memory Index (RBANS- DMI) at Week 13
outcomeMeasures.description: The RBANS is a brief, individually administered test measuring attention, language, visuospatial/constructional abilities, and immediate and delayed memory. It consists of 12 subtests, which yield 5 Index scores and a Total Scale score. Lower scores indicate worse performance on the test (and thus greater impairment). Scores for the RBANS DMI range from 40 (greater impairment) to 160 (improved function), with higher scores indicating improved function.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Repeatable Battery for the Assessment of Neurological Status (RBANS) Total Score at Week 13
outcomeMeasures.description: The RBANS is a brief, individually administered test measuring attention, language, visuospatial/constructional abilities, and immediate and delayed memory. It consists of 12 subtests, which yield 5 Index scores and a Total Scale score. Lower scores indicate worse performance on the test (and thus greater impairment). The RBANS total score ranges from 40 to 160, with higher scores indicating improved function.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Alzheimer's Disease Cooperative Study Activities of Daily Living Inventory (ADCS-ADL) Total Score at Week 13
outcomeMeasures.description: The ADCS-ADL is an interviewer-administered informant-based scale where the informant (caregiver) responds to 23 activities of daily living questions about the participant. The questions range from basic to instrumental activities of daily living. The total score ranges from 0-78 and a higher score signifies greater functional ability.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Mini-Mental State Exam (MMSE) Total Score at Week 13
outcomeMeasures.description: The MMSE consists of 11 items covering orientation, memory (recent and immediate), concentration, language and praxis. Total score ranges from 0 (severe cognitive impairment) to 30 (intact cognitive function), with lower scores indicating greater cognitive impairment. In participants with a diagnosis of AD, lower scores indicating worse disease. A score of 20 to 24 suggests mild dementia, 13 to 20 suggests moderate dementia, and less than 12 indicates severe dementia.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline in Clinical Dementia Rating Sum of Boxes Score (CDR-SB) at Week 13
outcomeMeasures.description: The CDR was developed primarily to assess severity level in persons with dementia. Six domains were assessed and then synthesized to assign a Global CDR score. The domains were memory, orientation, judgment and problem solving, community affairs, home and hobbies, and personal care. Impairment was defined only when caused by cognitive loss rather than by physical disability or other non-cognitive factors. CDR is an ordinal parameter (scale 0 \[least impairment\]-3 \[severe impairment\]). CDR-SB score was obtained by summing each of the domain box scores, with scores ranging from 0 (least impairment) to 18 (severe impairment).

outcomeMeasures.title: Clinical Global Impression - Improvement (CGI-I) Score
outcomeMeasures.description: The CGI-I employs a 7-point Likert scale to measure the overall improvement in the participant's condition post-treatment. The Investigator rated the participant's total improvement whether or not it was due entirely to drug treatment. Response choices included: 0=not assessed, 1=very much improved, 2=much improved, 3=minimally improved, 4=no change, 5=minimally worse, 6=much worse, and 7=very much worse.

explanation_target: Reason: The investigational drug BPN14770 is a selective, allosteric (negative allosteric modulator) small‑molecule inhibitor of phosphodiesterase‑4D (PDE4D) that increases cAMP signaling and enhances synaptic plasticity and memory in preclinical models; Phase 1 data also showed signals of cognitive benefit in elderly volunteers. These effects are aimed at improving cognition/ memory rather than directly removing or modifying core Alzheimer’s pathology (amyloid or tau). citeturn0search1turn0search2turn0search3

Act (extracted trial details): The described study is the PICASSO AD Phase 2 trial — a randomized, double‑blind, placebo‑controlled, 3‑arm (two active doses of BPN14770 vs placebo) study in patients with early Alzheimer’s disease; primary endpoint is change in RBANS‑Delayed Memory Index (memory/cognition measure). This confirms the trial’s intent to test cognitive/memory improvement. citeturn1search0turn2search2

Reflect: Given the drug’s mechanism (PDE4D inhibition → cAMP/CREB/BDNF pathway; memory/neuroplasticity enhancement) and the trial’s cognitive endpoints, the appropriate category from the provided list is "cognitive enhancer". Although BPN14770 is a small molecule, it does not primarily target canonical AD pathology (amyloid/tau), so it does not fit the "disease‑targeted small molecule" category as defined. Key supporting sources: PubMed preclinical/translation summaries and mechanism papers, NIH summary describing it as a PDE4D NAM memory drug, and the sponsor (Tetra) Phase 2 trial page / ClinicalTrials.gov listing for PICASSO AD. citeturn0search1turn0search3turn2search8
explanation_agent: Reason: BPN14770 is a selective, allosteric (negative allosteric modulator) inhibitor of phosphodiesterase‑4D (PDE4D) that raises neuronal cAMP, increases pCREB/BDNF and enhances hippocampal LTP and memory in preclinical models — a mechanism directed at boosting synaptic plasticity and cognitive function rather than directly modifying amyloid or tau pathology. citeturn0search1turn0search7

Act: Extracted trial details — drug: BPN14770 (PDE4D allosteric inhibitor / PDE4D‑NAM); indication: early Alzheimer’s disease cognitive enhancement (PICASSO AD Phase 2 design testing memory/cognition endpoints). These details confirm the intervention is a synaptic plasticity / cognitive‑enhancing approach. citeturn0search7turn0search8

Reflect: Classification as M) Synaptic Plasticity/Neuroprotection fits the described mechanism (PDE4D → ↑cAMP → ↑CREB/BDNF → enhanced synaptic plasticity and memory). Although some preclinical work links downstream effects to Aβ‑related pathways, the primary and stated target is modulation of synaptic signaling and cognition rather than direct amyloid/tau targeting, so M is the most specific CADRO category. citeturn0search5turn0search1
